text: Nonverbal communication accounts for approximately 93% of communication meaning, with 55% through body language and 38% through tone of voice.
Eye contact patterns vary significantly across cultures. In many Asian cultures, extended eye contact can be seen as disrespectful, while in Western cultures it often conveys trustworthiness.
AAC (Augmentative and Alternative Communication) systems can use eye tracking technology to allow individuals to control communication devices using only eye movements.
